page.title: 14HISTORY
page.content:
Thurlstone Moors.
Millhouse Green takes ts name from the mill on the river. The 'Green' in olden times was the pasture nearest to a village (in this case, Thurlstone).
The area is crossed by the salt track; the pack horse trail used by the salt merchants crossing the Pennines from the Cheshire salt mines to Doncaster. The original track went over Hartcliff Hill and Hillside. In 1741 the turnpike surveyor avoided the hill by making a detour through Millhouse and Thurlstone.
